description: From Middle English previsioun, from Old French prevision, from Late Latin praevisio, praevisionem, from Latin praevideo.

examples: I watched her without knowing, with a prevision that she was going to address me, though with no sort of idea as to the subject of her address.

verbs.description: prevision (third-person singular simple present previsions, present participle previsioning, simple past and past participle previsioned)

entries.meaning: To predict or envision the future.
